page.title: 19Local resident- Mr Swanson
page.content: In my view our village is the best on the north-east coast and has a history to be proud of,because in the 16, 17 and 18th centuries it was a major seaport,exporting glass bottles, coal, copper and salt to all parts of England and over to the Baltic states of Europe. It also had engineering works boat building, the Royal Hartley bottleworks and the salt pans. The bottleworks had six cones. according to the records3o,686 tons of coal,3OO tons of salt and 1OO tons of copper were exported each year. On may 2Oth 1872 the last ship sailed out called the Liberty of Boston with a cargo of bottles for the channel islands.
